full_text:
Nick Chubb's patience/size + having an experienced o-line is a dangerous combo. He was the only RB in 2020 w/ avg. of >3s behind the line of scrimmage per rush attempt yet still had a rushing percentage over expected of >40%
(Best RB was 51.7% ROE%) 

#nflverse #NFL #NFLTwitter https://t.co/04Ytnx2vFW

Excited to finally publish my 2021 #nfl projection model.  I used a mix of distributional modelling and bayesian updating to project the results of each game this season.  Initial predictions here and model description in thread #nflverse https://t.co/JEQ0nozQ7h

In meantime, huge shoutout to @LeeSharpeNFL @nflseedR @nflfastR and the whole #nflverse with additional shoutouts to @thomas_mock since I stole his {gt}.  Let me know if you have questions or want your team's schedule.  And eventually, I'll clean up all the code for GitHub!

Chances are increasing that we will soon have a very cool new feature in @nflfastR. A new ggplot2 geom that conveniently plots nfl team logos even with the alpha channel as an aesthetic! #nflverse https://t.co/OwZFXGYQA7
We need more punter graphs in #nflverse https://t.co/WnnCZOdz0I

The #nflverse games data has now been updated to reflect this change.

Note that this is now listed as a neutral site game. https://t.co/pXcVwnezNX

@nflseedR I tried simulate_nfl() for 2021 by filtering the year out from load_sharpe_games() and got results back yet there's been no games yet. What criteria would it use there? 

#nflverse

To add to the Lamar Jackson discourse, he isn't as bad at passing in the playoffs in obvious passing situations that people make him out to be. When his expected pass % is over 70%, he has a similar EPA to Mahomes in the playoffs. #nflverse https://t.co/R7gImE4dB4
